one_reviews_text: this game is AMAZING!!!!  i would highly reccomend this game 100% to people that like hockey and play vr. once you get used to the game and its controlls it is pretty easy to manage and play. took me no time to get used to the game, and they also got a discord server if you want to play on a team, everyone in the server is verry frendly. love this game!!
review_feedback: Thanks luquid!

one_reviews_text:
I know it's probably hard to create realistic friction with an imaginary stick and puck but if it could be refined just a tad more to make dangles more realistic I could see this becoming a real big thing. Maybe even sell to EA down the line.

Edit after Dev response: Still needs a lot of work. Puck control is more responsive but still can't justify bothering to play. Probably not at your fault but at the current development of VR. Multiplayer is just a completely frustrating experience as the puck won't even respond to touches the same way it does in single player making a fun competitive experience feel just stupid.

Edit 2: Six months later, I don't know what updates were made but I can't tell a difference, I feel like a ghost, puck comes to me I move it in front of me, it's behind me, defender cuts in front of me, I poke the puck he glides right past me and scores. It's bad. I like the attempt and I like how you're pushing for the future of VR but I don't get why it's THAT bad. Blue team was making tape to tape passes and I can't even touch the puck without it glitching.

Edit 3: Didn't watch the tutorial because the issue is the puck not responding to stick touch, I don't know what a video would help with that? Also it's more like table hockey than actual hockey, most players only use one hand to push the puck around...that's not hockey that's something else. Sorry man we're at minimum 20-30 years behind technology to where this could be amazing. Thanks though for the effort it seems some people do enjoy this.
review_feedback: The video shows how to play defense (take the puck) effectively despite the inherent network latency. I appreciate you not bombing the review, I've indeed sunk over 2 years of effort into making this as good as it can be and continue to tune!

one_reviews_text:
Me and friend hop into the game, and it was really hard to enjoy. I tried using sidequest with quest2, but app would not get full screen, it was windowed. so I had to go with the cable and the thing was reaalllllllly laggy (we try quitting the game / rejoining a couples of times), coulnt get it working. My specs are not REALLY good, Im still stuck with a GTX970ti, but I mean I run every other games (no man sky, arktika, onward, pingpong etc). I was expecting that little hockey game to be really less hungry on resources ? (I don't even think my computer was really rushing to be honest. Simply buggy).

My friend on the RIFT had nausea after 5 minutes (he usually has no motion sickness when we play together).

So yeah, not quite as expected.
review_feedback: I'd love if you could join our discord and I can help you troubleshoot. The game was tested even on a gtx 1050 and ran smoothly for us. https://electricfalcon.net/discord

review_title: Potential to be a killer VR sports game
one_reviews_text:
At its core, this is the most fun I have ever had in VR. The controls are intuitive, if more like mini-sticks than actual ice hockey. That's okay though, because playing mini-sticks in the basement as a kid was one of my favorite pastimes. 

You'll get used to the game and become good at it quickly if you ignore the two hand mode, learn how to sprint (double-tap right trigger), and communicate with your teammates (let them know when pressure is on them, or when/where you're open). 

For a 3D client-server game, the puck physics are surprisingly good. There can be some frustrating moments where the puck seems to stick to an opponent's stick and you can't poke it away no matter what, but I think that's just a limitation of what's possible with netcode at this point.

There's a great community on Discord, and it seems like a small community league is starting to come together.
review_feedback: Thank you for your support! Glad you like the game :)

one_reviews_text: LEft handed mode does ABSOLUTELY NOTHING!!! For ease of use and comfort this game lacks HUGELY when it comes to left handed players.
review_feedback: Lefty mode requires you to click the 'reset practice' button or disconnect from the server to take effect. I hope this works, please let me know! Join our discord for help: electricfalcon.net/discord

one_reviews_text:
This is the begininng stages of what could be a very good Hockey sim, the dev seems very active and listens to everyones concerns. I am very hopeful that someday this will be a great Hockey sim, I will keep a close eye on this one during development.

Oh and its FREE! can't go wrong with that.

one_reviews_text: the devs are awsome the game is awesome not much more you could ask for save playable goalies. @wraith (electricfalcon) (;
review_feedback: Thanks!

one_reviews_text:
Take about 3 minutes to learn and people are very helpful in the games with any questions.  900 downloads on the GO alone in the first day (I have rift don't know how many rifters) but I'm tellin ya this is what hockey should be like in VR.  DEV is nowhere near done and listens to ideas.  He made it free because he got injured playing hocky irl and wanted people to play with so he made this game so he could share his love of hockey with the world.  NHL would be stupid to not get him some dev help and license the thing.  

Don't be surprised if this is VR's next big thing I have more fun with this than echo arena.   The fights on the boards for the puck are hectic and its so fun to land the perfect pass to the guy in front of the net.   Buy this game ASAP.  Wait its free so there's NO EXCUSE not to download it right now.  In fact why are you reading this and not playing?
review_feedback: I certainly hope it becomes a big thing! Thanks!

one_reviews_text:
To be short, if you own a Oculus you should get this!

Easily the best free Oculus sports game besides Echo Arena. I didnt expect much when downloading it, but I was shocked. While the graphics and gameplay are simple and it is no big budget game, it is a really fun and simple hockey game! I happened to get in a game with the Dev and got to talk to him which was really cool. Great job for a single dev game and the fact he made it free is just well, amazing! I would happily pay for a game like this as like Echo Arena, you can play over and over and still enjoy it. So great job and thanks for making this free for everyone! I can't wait to see what is added to this game in the future as I think adding things like a more polished engine, better physics, better graphics, and just overall giving this game a good polish could easily make it be up there with games like Beat Saber and Echo Arena! Hope this game will continue to be improved and I am looking forward to seeing what the future holds for this one!
review_feedback: Glad you enjoyed it! Thanks for the great feedback!

one_reviews_text: The game has simple graphics, but once you're into the game and flying around the ice against other players you really get immersed. Taking a slapshot, flipping a behind the back pass to set up your teammates shot is a great feeling. Its a lot of fun to just skate around body checking the opposing players too!

This game is amazing! I've always wanted to play hockey IRL. It's amazing how in the zone I feel while playing. I'd highly recommend this game to anyone with a remote interest in hockey. You'll have a blast!
review_feedback: Best part is, theres no MCP to ruin your day!

one_reviews_text: When you Downlode a game for free, you just think it will be a 10-20 min thing and forget about it, Not this game! I Started to play form 18:00, next time i looked at the clock it said 03:20! You get lost in the fun. Great game! Devs are super nice and is looking to make it the best it can be! 5/5!!!
review_feedback: Thanks!

one_reviews_text:
Ever since you've played NHL on console, you've always thought to yourself, "I just wish there was a way to have full control of the player.. "  

Well, now there's a way.  

Use your own two hands to control a stick and dangle your way down the ice, shoot nasty clap bombs, and snipe filthy wristers.  This game is great.  I found myself spinning in circles and got tangled up in my rift cords for a minute.  Didn't matter.  Love this game.  

If you like hockey, whatsoever and in any fashion, try this game.
review_feedback: Thanks for the great review!

review_feedback: Hi! I just wanted to follow-up with you and let you know there was a major netcode improvement about 2 weeks ago. I'd encourage you to try it again and let me know how it goes. Thanks!

one_reviews_text: Not ready to be released on Oculus store.  Nice concept.  Needs a lot of work (start with fixing the locomotion/tyrning
review_feedback: What would you suggest for the locomotion? I'd love for you to join our discord group (check www.electricfalcon.net/pickuphockey) so we can discuss it further. Currently it only allows skating forwards and backwards because thats normally how skating works! I will probably be adding a form of joystick locomotion with limited strafing in the future but the goal is to be as close to real hockey as is reasonably possible. Many of the skilled players are actually arguing against adding sideways movement, since you can free-coast and look in any direction you want anyway.
